workflow.name: Send crypto BUY/SELL alerts for top 5 coins with OpenAI, WhatsApp, Telegram, and email
workflow.description:
## Overview

This workflow is designed to monitor the Top 5 cryptocurrencies in real-time, calculate trading signals (BUY, SELL, HOLD), and send human-readable alerts through multiple channels. It integrates data fetching, signal processing, AI-generated insights, and multi-channel notifications to provide a professional-grade crypto monitoring solution.

## Setup

1. Schedule the trigger
2. Fetch real-time coin data (CoinGecko, Binance API)
3. Filter only required fields
4. Check each data from loop
5. Add the logic for minimum percentage comparison
6. Use AI for analysis enhanced insights
8. Send the notification only if signal is 'SELL' or  'BUY'

## Key Features

- Real-Time Crypto Monitoring: Continuously evaluates the top 5 cryptocurrencies for trading signals.
- Dynamic Signal Calculation: Generates BUY, SELL, HOLD signals based on 24h price change.
- If price changed below or above 2% the dynamic signal will assign to dedicated coin.
- Signal Change Alerts: Sends notifications only when meaningful changes occur.
- Human-Readable Messaging: Converts numeric signals into readable alerts.
- AI Insights: Provides explanations or trading advice via OpenAI.
- Multi-Channel Delivery: Supports WhatsApp, Telegram, and Email.
- Looped Processing: Each coin is processed independently for accurate alerting.
- Wait / Delay Node: Prevents API rate limit issues and controls alert flow.
## Requirements

1. OpenAI API
2. WhatsApp API
3. Telegram API
4. SMTP Credentials or Gmail Credentials.

messageValues.message: You are a professional crypto trading assistant.  Your task is to analyze the following coin signals and provide insights.Do not repeat instructions.  Include the coin symbol, signal, and a short recommendation.

parameters.content:
## Overview
This workflow is designed to monitor the Top 5 cryptocurrencies in real-time, calculate trading signals (BUY, SELL, HOLD), and send human-readable alerts through multiple channels. It integrates data fetching, signal processing, AI-generated insights, and multi-channel notifications to provide a professional-grade crypto monitoring solution.

## How It Works - Process Flow

1. Schedule the trigger
2. Fetch real-time coin data (CoinGecko, Binance API)
3. Filter only required fields
4. Check each data from loop
5. Add the logic for minimum percentage comparison
6. Use AI for analysis enhanced insights
8. Send the notification only if signal is 'SELL' or  'BUY'

## Fetch data and field select
 
Fetch the latest coin data from crypto APi (CoinGecko, Binance or CoinMarketCap)
Use last 24h API endpoint to get last 24 data from selected coins

Select only relevant field from the endpoint like symbol, priceChange24h, and so.

## Calculate Signal Node
 
This node applies the trading rules to each coins like BUY, SELL, HOLD 

If this percentage increased by 2% this will alert to SELL and if percentage drop by 2% this will alert to BUY 

You can adjust the percentage based on coin circulations.

## Check Signal Status
 
This node will allow to proceed only if signal status is 'SELL' or 'BUY'

HOLD coins will not be allowed to go further steps.

You can add logic for HOLD status coins if needed.

## Decision Routing
 
Once get the signal results this will pass to alerting pipeline

Add user message node prepares a formatted message with the coin, signal, 24h changes and time

## AI Model
 
Using OpenAI API to enhances the alerts with human-readable insights and recommendations.

Consolidated all the signals into a readable format for notifications channels

## Notifications
 
Send alert through multiple channels.

1. Whatsapp
2. Telegram
3. Email

professional multiple channel delivery.

user.name: Mohamed Abubakkar
user.bio:
I am a full stack developer focused on building AI-driven automation solutions for companies, founders, and business owners. I specialize in using tools like n8n to automate business analytics, daily reporting, alerts, and follow-ups, helping teams make faster, data-driven decisions. With strong experience across backend, frontend, databases, and AI integrations, I design end-to-end automation workflows that reduce manual work and deliver clear, actionable insights.

üìß n8n.abubakkar@gmail.com

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
